actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works and Transportation
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Public Works and Transportation.

official_title: A bill to establish a commission to study the desirability of establishing a single intergovernmental authority to manage and finance the provision of mass transportation, air quality control, water, solid waste disposal, and sewer services in the Washington, DC,  metropolitan region.

summary.text: Establishes the Washington Metropolitan Region Study Commission to determine whether it would be advisable for the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Virginia, and the State of Maryland to enter into an interstate compact to establish a single intergovernmental authority to coordinate, finance, and manage the provision of mass transportation, air quality control, water, solid waste disposal, and sewer services in the Washington metropolitan region.

titles.title: A bill to establish a commission to study the desirability of establishing a single intergovernmental authority to manage and finance the provision of mass transportation, air quality control, water, solid waste disposal, and sewer services in the Washington, DC,  metropolitan region.
